item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds Title Update 1 Details Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/monster-hunter-wilds-title-update-1-details-revealed/

Capcom has revealed that Monster Hunter Wilds Title Update 1 will launch on Thursday April 3/Friday April 4, depending on your time zone.

The reveal came as part of a 15-minute video on Tuesday that went into details on what players can expect to see in the game‚Äôs first major update.

First thing‚Äôs first, the title update will be free to all players. It will include a new monster called Mizutsune alongside a new Zoh Shia quest. There is also a new Grand Hub gathering place that players who‚Äôve completed the game‚Äôs main story can get together and hangout as well as play a new game called Barrel Bowling. If you want a different type of entertainment, The Diva will be there to perform at night.

Aside from the title update at the beginning of April, there is more to come in late April and May. There is the Festival of Accord: Blossomdance coming from April 22/23 to May 6/7. The Arch-tempered Rey Dau event quest also comes at the end of April and lasts through late May.

Lastly, the second free title update for Monster Hunter Wilds will launch later this summer. That update will include an additional monster, a new seasonal event, and more.

item.title: At Least Three Major Publishers Are Ready to Delay Games Just to Avoid GTA 6
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/at-least-three-major-publishers-are-ready-to-delay-games-just-to-avoid-gta-6/

All eyes in the video game industry are watching to see when Grand Theft Auto 6 will release. The potential impact on the industry is expected to be very large, but several publishers planning to release games around the same time are ready to delay just to get out of its way.

‚ÄúWe Don‚Äôt Want to Be Anywhere Near That‚Äù

According to Christopher Dring of the recently launched outlet The Game Business, ‚Äúthree major video game publishers‚Äù are ready to delay their games to avoid GTA 6. Dring says that the boss ‚Äúof one of the world‚Äôs biggest game publishers‚Äù told him: ‚ÄúRockstar games always suck a lot of money and, more importantly, time out of the market. We don‚Äôt want to be anywhere near that. We are working up multiple different plans for our titles.‚Äù

This past weekend at the Game Developer‚Äôs Conference in San Francisco, Insider Gaming‚Äôs Tom Henderson was told by a few developers that they‚Äôre ‚Äúwaiting to see what GTA 6 does.‚Äù Back in December, Bloomberg‚Äôs Jason Schreier reported that competing publishers are ‚Äúwaiting as long as possible to commit to their release date.‚Äù

The launch of GTA 6, tentatively scheduled for October 2025, reportedly isn‚Äôt just scaring off major new releases. According to Dring, two developers of ‚Äútop 10 live-service games‚Äù are not planning any significant updates during the GTA 6 launch window. One studio boss reportedly said that they would ‚Äúnudge‚Äù their releases ahead or backwards three weeks just to avoid GTA 6. The studio heads that spoke to Dring spoke of other potential issues, like a crowded schedule of other games trying to avoid GTA 6, but those problems seem preferable than trying to compete with a potentially industry-altering release. However, as one industry consultant noted at GDC, waiting on GTA 6 only for it to delay could ‚Äútank‚Äù those developers.
